intro: Boophone disticha, commonly known as the spear lily, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a perennial herb native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features tall, straight stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. Boophone disticha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
